intro: Ortholoma warszewiczii, commonly known as the San Diego ortholoma, is a flowering plant native to California, specifically found in the coastal regions of San Diego County. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit, with slender stems and small, clustered leaves. It produces delicate white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. This species is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and ecological significance in its native habitat.
